alert.note: Alert for Central and Southern Valley; Western Roosevelt (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 27 at 11:42AM MDT by NWS Glasgow
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Roosevelt and east central Valley Counties through 1245 PM MDT... At 1141 AM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles southwest of Lustre, or 22 miles northwest of Wolf Point, moving southeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of west central Roosevelt and east central Valley Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
